explanation: Lion-tailed macaque is endemic to the Western Ghats of Tamil Nadu and Kerala. It is endangered due to habitat loss.
Hoolock gibbon (the only ape in India) is found in the north-eastern states. It is endangered due to habitat loss and hunting.
The Indian rhinoceros is also known as the greater one-horned rhinoceros. It is found in India and Nepal.

prompt: Swamp deer (barasingha) has how many tines?
explanation: Barasingha (swamp deer) is named for its antlers that can have 10â€“12 tines. It is found in Kanha, Dudhwa, and a few other areas.

prompt: Hangul is the state animal of:
explanation: Hangul (Kashmiri stag) is the state animal of Jammu and Kashmir. It is critically endangered and found in Dachigam and nearby areas.
Sambar and chital are deer species (herbivores). They are prey for tigers and leopards and are found in many Indian forests.

answers: Largest bovine; herbivore; found in forests
explanation: Indian gaur is the largest species of bovine. It is a herbivore found in forest areas of India and Southeast Asia.

answers: Large antelope (blue bull); found in plains and light forest
explanation: Nilgai (blue bull) is the largest Asian antelope. It is found in plains and open forest in India; sometimes considered a crop pest.

prompt: Indian elephant is listed in Wildlife (Protection) Act Schedule:
explanation: Indian elephant is in Schedule I of the Wildlife (Protection) Act, affording it the highest protection.
Project Tiger was launched by the Government of India in 1973 under Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

prompt: Tiger is the national animal of:
explanation: The tiger is the national animal of India. It was declared so in 1973, replacing the lion.

prompt: Peacock (Indian peafowl) is the national bird of:
explanation: The Indian peafowl (peacock) is the national bird of India. It is protected under Schedule I of the Wildlife (Protection) Act.
The banyan tree (Ficus bengalensis) is the national tree of India.
The lotus (Nelumbo nucifera) is the national flower of India. It is sacred in Indian culture.
The Ganges river dolphin was declared the national aquatic animal of India in 2010 to promote its conservation.

prompt: Crocodile Conservation Project was launched for:
answers: Conservation of mugger, gharial, saltwater crocodile
explanation: The Crocodile Conservation Project was launched to conserve the three species of crocodilians in India: mugger, gharial, and saltwater crocodile.
Project Hangul was launched for the conservation of the hangul (Kashmiri stag) in Jammu and Kashmir.

prompt: Indian Council of Forestry Research and Education (ICFRE) is in:
explanation: ICFRE is headquartered in Dehradun. It is the apex body for forestry research and education in India.

prompt: Indian Institute of Forest Management (IIFM) is in:
explanation: IIFM is located in Bhopal. It is a premier institute for forest management education and research.
Forest Research Institute (FRI) is in Dehradun. It is one of the oldest and largest institutions for forestry research.
